OpenORB.description: This config file contains all the modules available to users of OpenORB. Users may import modules from this file into their configuration and modify the properties.

module.name: openorb.server
module.description: Properties affecting the orb server side. This module has no initializer and does not have to be imported.

property.name: enable
property.description: Enable the ORB server side. The server side may be disabled for a client only orb.

property.name: alias
property.description:
The server alias. This is used in persistent references. All servers listening on the same port, on the same host, with the same server alias can accept requests to persistent targets created previous incarnations of the same server.
The command line alias -ORBSrvName=name can be used rather than -ORBopenorb.server.name=name, regardless of if this module is imported.

property.name: maxQueueSize
property.description: Maximum number of incomming requests to queue before replying with TRANSIENT exceptions.

property.name: maxManagerHeldRequests
property.description: Maximum number of requests that an adapter with a manager in the HOLDING state can hold before incomming requests are replied to with TRANSIENT exceptions

property.name: minThreadPoolSize
property.description: Minimum number of active threads in the request thread pool. The thread pool will never shrink beyond this size.

property.name: maxThreadPoolSize
property.description: Maximum number of pool threads. The thread pool will never grow beyond this size.

property.name: reapCloseDelay
property.description: Reaper close time in ms. If a channel is unused for at least this time it will be closed to conserve resources. The thread pool also has a chance to shrink each time this event occours. With a value of 0 no reaper thread will be installed and thus no channels will be closed automatically.

property.name: serverManagerClass
property.description: Server manager class. There is no alternative at present.

module.name: openorb.client
module.description: Properties affecting the orb client side. This module has no initializer and does not have to be imported.

property.name: reapPauseDelay
property.description: Reaper pause time in ms. If a channel is unused for at least this time it will be closed to conserve resources.

property.name: enable
property.description: Enable the client side. Server only orbs are possible however certain POA functionality will be unavailable.

property.name: clientManagerClass
property.description: Client manager class. There is no alternative at present.

property.name: bindings.discard_old
property.description: NOTE: Proprietary Extension (Encorus, Twister Application Server) When this property is set to true the binding array will be completely discarded upon the reception of a LOCATION_FORWARD reply. The spec. requires that new endpoints will be added to the array but the old ones should not be removed completely as they might become valid again. This feature is currently used to achieve some kind of load balancing (LBS) for EJB objects for the EJB container of a J2EE application server. An IOR for application objects contains a set of endpoints: (AppObj, LBS). When a request to the application object fails the ORB transparently tries to switch to the second endpoint 'LBS'. The LBS is a service that notices when an application object request arrives that the connection to the application object must have died and reacts to such a request by creating a new object. After the creation of a new application object has been completed successfully a new IOR is created with the following set of endpoints: (NewAppObj, LBS). The new IOR is returned to the client via a LOCATION_FORWARD reply. With the discard_old property set to true the client ORB discards all old binding information by substituting it with the new bindings created from the endpoints of the just received IOR. This guarantees that new requests will not be sent to the old object endpoint anymore as this object has most probably died.

property.name: policy_cache.enable
property.description: The determination of the effective set of policies for an object is a very costly operation. In some environments it makes no sense of adjusting settings on the CORBA level like for EJB applications in a pure J2EE environment. The ORB wide policies will be applicable for all objects associated with this ORB. Therefore it should be possible to deactivate the costly merging of policies at the different levels: ORB, Thread, Object. This can be done by setting this property to true. No changing of policies will be possible after accessing the first object because the policies are already cached then.

module.name: openorb.pi
module.description: Properties affecting the portable interceptors. There are currently no alternatives to the defaults for these properties. This module has no initializer and does not have to be imported.

module.name: openorb
module.description: Misc other properties. This module has no initializer and does not have to be imported.

property.name: dynany.enable
property.description: Enable the use of the DynamicAnyFactory.

property.name: kernel.ORBConnectorClass
property.description: Define the orb connector class. There is currently no alternative.

property.name: defaultInitRef
property.description:
The default initial reference. This is used by resolve_initial_references when no other specific reference is available. The default behaviour is to have no default reference.
The command line alias -ORBDefaultInitRef=str can be used rather than -ORBopenorb.defaultInitRef=str, regardless of if this module is imported.

property.name: debug.trace
property.description:
Set the orb trace level
The trace level specifies the trace level of the logger. The values 0-4 correspond to the following levels: FATAL|ERROR|WARN|INFO|DEBUG

property.name: debug.level
property.description:
Set the orb debug level
The Jakarta LogKit provides only one debug level. To allow different debug levels we introduced the following debug level: OFF|LOW|MEDIUM|HIGH (0-3)

property.name: useStaticThreadGroup
property.description: Use static ThreadGroups for the orb threads. Can be useful to set to true when debugging the use of multiple orbs used in one app as it avoids large numbers of thread groups being created.

module.name: InitRef
module.description:
Module containing default initial references. To add more initial services import and define properties with unique identifiers. Example import:
<import xlink:href="${openorb.home}config/default.xml#InitRef"> <property name="NameService" value="corbaloc::1.2@localhost/NameService" /> </import>
Also see the defaultInitRef property, defined in the openorb module.

propertyset.description:
The compiler module defines a single property set which allows additional include directories for the openorb compiler. Each extra idl include directory property starts with idl and must have a unique extension. Example of import statement, adding an include:
<import xlink:href="${openorb.home}config/default.xml#compiler"> <property name="idl.xxx" value="URL" /> </import>
The include dir "${openorb.home}idl" is always present in the compiler include path, it always appears last in the include list.

module.name: BOA
module.description: The BOA module. Import this module to use the BOA.

module.name: POA
module.description: The POA module. Import this module to use the POA.

module.name: Messaging
module.description: The Messaging module. Import this module to use CORBA Messaging features.

module.name: CorbalocService
module.description: The corbaloc adapter module. When loaded it is possible to resolve corbaloc style addresses if they are registered.

module.name: ForwardAdapter
module.description: The ForwardAdapter module has been renamed CorbalocService.

profile.name: DefaultCorbalocService
profile.description: This profile loads the CorbalocService module, and sets the port number in iiop to 683, the default port.

profile.name: InitialReferencesService
profile.description: Initial references service has been renamed CorbalocService.

profile.name: BasicRefs
profile.description: Basic initial references. Just set the default initial reference.

module.name: rmi
module.description: The rmi module initializer installs interceptors for correct Java like exception handling.

property.name: defaultorbSingleton
property.description: When the first ORB instance is created the rmi DefaultORB will be initialized with the ORB instance. This is useful to avoid creating two ORBs when RMI-IIOP is used. Default false.

module.name: iiop
module.description: The IIOP protocol is the basic interoperability protocol between all orbs. It should be included in all profiles.

property.name: boostReceivePriority
property.description: Boosts the priority of receive worker threads, to avoid the BAD MAGIC problem under NT4.0 : true or false. Default false.

property.name: sendBufferSize
property.description: Sets the SO_SNDBUF socket property. A value of 0 indicates that the system default should be used. Default 0.

property.name: recieveBufferSize
property.description: Sets the SO_RCVBUF socket property. A value of 0 indicates that the system default should be used. Note that values above 64K cannot be set. Default 0.

property.name: bufferedInputStreamSize
property.description: Sets the size of a BufferedInputStream used to wrap a socket's InputStream. A value of 0 indicates that no buffer should be used. Default 0, however set to 2048 bytes to optimize header reading.

property.name: bufferedOutputStreamSize
property.description: Sets the size of a BufferedOutputStream used to wrap a socket's OutputStream. A value of 0 indicates that no buffer should be used. By using this type of buffer it is possible to reduce the number of problems encountered by writing to Microsoft peers. Default 0.

property.name: keepAlive
property.description: Setting of keep alive for sockets: true or false. Default false.

property.name: noDelay
property.description: Setting of no delay for sockets: true or false. Default true. Note that this property replaces clientNoDelay and serverNoDelay.

property.name: clientPortMin
property.description: Port range for outgoing client sockets number greater than 1023: Default -1 meaning ignored.

property.name: clientPortMax
property.description: Port range for outgoing client sockets number greater than 1024: Default -1 meaning ignored.

property.name: serverBacklogQueueLength
property.description: Sets the backlog queue length used when listening to server sockets. Default 50.

property.name: serverMaxSocketAcceptTimeout
property.description: Sets the maximum socket accept timeout. If a timeout greater than this value is used by the listen method then the value specified by serverOverrideSocketTimeout is used. Default 250.

property.name: serverMinSocketAcceptTimeout
property.description: Sets the minimum socket accept timeout. If a timeout less than or equal tothis value is used by the listen method then the value specified by serverOverrideSocketTimeout is used. Note that setting this value to -1 will cause the protocol runner to block forever on accept. This should be set to 0 if SSLIOP is used. Default 0.

property.name: serverOverrideSocketTimeout
property.description: Sets the override timeout to be used in place when a requested timeout is out of range. Default 250.

propertyset.description:
Sets the network address mappings used by the orb. The name specifies the original address and the value specifies the mapping.
Addresses are specified in the format: host[:port] where the port is optional.
Examples:
- Map "corba.foo.com:port" to "192.168.0.2:port":
- Map "corba.foo.com:60" to "corba.foo.com:6661":
- Map "corba.foo.com:port" to "foo.bar.com:6661":

property.name: hostname
property.description: Hostname to publish in IORs. If empty string or unspecified the published hostname will be determined by the publishIP setting.

property.name: publishIP
property.description: Publish IP address in IORs instead of hostname. The default setting of 'auto' will publish the IP address if the hostname is not a fqdn (does not contain a . ). If true the IP address is always used. For all other values the hostname is used. If the hostname property is set this overrides this setting.

propertyset.description:
This property set defines alternate IIOP endpoints which are published in IORs. These are generaly servers on different targets. Each defined alternative should have a unique prefix. E.g. two alternative endpoints can be specified like this:
The same can be specified via properties like this: iiop.alternateAddr.endpoint1 localhost:6661 iiop.alternateAddr.endpoint2 localhost:6662

property.name: listenAddress
property.description: Address to listen on on multi-homed host. Defaults to 0.0.0.0, all local addresses.

property.name: port
property.description:
Port for the iiop transport to listen on. Defaults to 0, any available port.
Command line alias Port is available.

property.name: allowBidir
property.description: Allow bidirectional IIOP. For BiDirectional IIOP to be available at all this property must be set to true. It is set to true by default, since activating BiDirectional IIOP requires setting server and client side policies.

property.name: biDirOnlyServer
property.description: When both allowBiDir and biDirOnlyServer are true, the server side orb will not listen for incomming requests. All incomming requests must be recieved over a bidirectional channel.

property.name: CDRInputStreamClass
property.description: CDRInputStream class. This is modified by the RMIoverIIOP module.

property.name: CDROutputStreamClass
property.description: CDRInputStream class. This is modified by the RMIoverIIOP module.

property.name: TransportServerInitializerClass
property.description: Server transport. This is modified by security services.

property.name: TransportClientInitializerClass
property.description: Client transport. This is modified by security services.

property.name: deserializationEngine
property.description:
This property allows configuration of the deserialization engine to use for RMI-IIOP and Java Serializable unmarshaling.
Possible values:
- 'auto': use automatic detection of the VM vendor and create a VM dependent marshaling engine. For a list of supported VMs please see the JavaDoc of the DeserializationKernelFactory class.
- 'native': use a native library and JNI. This works with any VM but requires native code plus special setup of the VM environment in your operating system. The native library can be found in the native CVS module, including precompiled binaries for some platforms.
- 'none': no support for RMI-IIOP, even if your VM supports it. Use this option to make sure that your software does not use any ORB features that depend on the VM.
A prefix of 'lazy:' avoids creation at ORB startup time and defers creation of the deserialization engine until it is first used.
Using 'lazy:' is not recommended if you need to achieve fail-fast behaviour. Using the 'lazy:' prefix is recommended if you are not sending Serializables over the wire - your application will work even if your VM is not supported for 'auto' or the operating system is not set up correctly for 'native'.
Default value for deserializationEngine is 'lazy:auto'.

propertyset.description: Sets the socket stream decoration strategies. Property names are used to set the order of application. Classes must implement the org.openorb.orb.net.SocketStreamDecorationStrategy.Factory interface. If this set is empty then the set defaults to the entries stated below.

profile.name: default
profile.description: The default profile load the POA, iiop and some basic initial references.

profile.name: rmi
profile.description: A profile to load the POA, iiop, rmi and some basic initial references.

profile.name: boa-only
profile.description: This profile uses the BOA instead of the POA.

profile.name: client-only
profile.description: This profile enables only the client side orb.
